text: Kamulu is a small town located roughly 40 Kilometers from Nairobi Central Business District, Kenya within Nairobi County, Kasarani Constituency, Ruai Location. It lies on the east side of Jomo Kenyatta International Airport bordering Katani and Githunguri on the South East, Drumvale on the East, Joska to the South, Ruai/Embakasi Ranching on the North West. It is in Ruai Division with a population of 26, 448 people. ==Local Administration== Kamulu entirely belongs to the Ruai Location which is part and parcel of the greater Kasarani constituency. The area can be accessed through Kangundo Road. ==Parts of Kamulu== Some of the key location names in Kamulu include Stage 26, Acacia, Kanisani, Kingoris, Kamulu Shopping Center. The boundary between Nairobi and Machakos county lies on one end of the Kamulu area with the exact point being the Athi River Bridge (Kwa Daraja) just before Joska town outbound of Nairobi according to District & Boundaries Act of 1992https://www.nis.go.ke/downloads/Districts%20and%20ProvincesAct,5%20of1992.pdf. As such Joska, KBC, Mutalia, and Kantafu fall within the Machakos County side of the border despite often being mistaken for being parts of Kamulu. ==Notable Landmarks== The region is home to the Brookshine Schoolshttps://www.brookshine.ac.ke/, St. Vincente De Paul Catholic Church, and Ng'undu Primary School. The Nairobi River and Mbagathi River also pass through the peripheries of this area making it a key part of the Athi River Basinhttps://www.oceandocs.org/bitstream/handle/1834/7275/ktf0393.pdf. ==Kamulu Real Estate== The Kamulu neighborhood remains ones of the most sought-after areas for real estate development. In 2016, Kamulu was ranked among the fastest growing real-estate areas along Kangundo Road by the Standard Grouphttps://www.standardmedia.co.ke/article/2000203048/why-nairobi- residents-are-flocking-to-kangundo-road Standard Group. == References == Category:Populated places in Nairobi Province Category:Suburbs of Nairobi Category:Populated places in Kenya Category:Nairobi
title: Kamulu
